2004 was the first full year of reporting under the Water Supply (Water Quality) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2002 therefore direct comparisons with previous years' data can not be made as some of the standards have changed and may have been added or removed from the Regulations.

column3: 1995 data covers the 15 month period October 1994 - December 1995.
1996 data covers the 15 month period October 1995 - December 1996.
Prescribed concentration value (PCV): the numerical value assigned to water quality standards defining the maximum or minimum legal concentration
or value of a parameter.  A relaxation of the standards may be granted, subject to the completion of improvement works, in emergencies
or as a result of exceptional meteorological conditions or by reason of the nature and structure of the ground in the area from which the supply emanates.
From 1 January 2004 Coliform bacteria no longer schedule 1 in zones.
2004 onwards was reporting under the Water Supply (Water Quality) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2002
therefore direct comparisons with previous years' data can not be made as some of the standards have changed and may have been added or removed from the Regulations.

column18: Percentage of determinations exceeding PCV b. or relaxed PCV b.

column4: Zones not complying with regulatory requirements
column18: Percentage of zones exceeding PCV b. or relaxed PCV b.
